name: operation, housing system, pig, fully-slatted floor | operation, housing system, pig, fully-slatted floor, per pig place | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11142/documentation

The module includes the use of energy and auxiliary materials for the operation of lighting, ventilation, heating, feeding system, slurry agitator and pump, cleaning, drinking water. The functional unit is 1 fattening pig place during 1 year.

The inventory takes into account the electricity and propane, and auxiliary materials like water for drinking and service, lubricating oil and cleaning agents for the use of the described module for one year. Also included is the use of the infrastructure with the binding of a certain part of the appropriate infrastructure module. Not taken into account were the direct emission of the animal husbandry, fodder production and produced waste water. Note that a wastewater flow is missing that should be added to ensure water mass balance across pig farm (see Modelling information for details and value).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/014:Animal production/0145:Raising of swine/pigs

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Energy and water data have been contextualized to the region of Québec. Other data of the inventory (e.g. infrastructure, oil) refer to Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The use of auxiliary materials are calculated for the conditions defined in the infrastructure-module with literature data and experts knowledge. Energy and water data are representative of Quebec farrow-to-finish swine production (about 75% of Quebec swine production)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Except for energy and water data which are representative of Québec region, and adpatation of infrastructure lifespan, this dataset has been extrapolated from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly. The amount of hydrogen peroxyde has been scaled to water input.
Note that the functional unit refers to 1 fattening pig place during one year. So, conversion between head/livestock unit/fattening pig place was necessary using the following livestock unit (LU) data: 5 fattening pigs are worth 1 LU; 25 piglets are worth 1 LU; 4 sows  (including the unweaned piglets) are worth 1 LU (source: http://www.mrchr.qc.ca/documents/amenagementautres/annexes.pdf). Hence, equivalencies are: 1 piglet is worth 5/25 fattening pig place, and 1 sow is worth 5/4 fattening pig place.
A wastewater flow has been identified and calculated that could not be added to the dataset because it is not included in the original parent dataset. The flow corresponds to a fraction of the wastewater generated in the housing system that is not directed with manure to the liquid manure storage (Quantis, 2012). The actual amount has been calculated so as to ensure water mass balance across the pig farm, assuming that overall water input to the pig farm (including water contained in the feed) less water output (emission to the air and water going out with finished pig, with dead animals and with manure) ends up as wastewater. Note that water input contained in feed and water output with animals and manure is inventoried outside this dataset, within the swine production dataset.
The user of the dataset should add this missing wastewater flow as follows:
wastewater, average= 0.8158	m3 per FU. Uncertainty: Variance of log-transformed data=0.04; Pedigree matrix=5,5,1,2,1

Quantis, 2012. Principales données et hypothèses pour l"évaluation du bilan eau du secteur porcin au Québec. Rapport pour la Fédération des Producteurs de Porc du Québec (FPPQ). http://www.calculateurcarboneeteau.leseleveursdeporcsduquebec.com/userfiles/files/pdf/fr/rapport.pdf
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The inventory for energy and water data is from Québec LCA literature (source: Quantis, 2012 and OCO Technologies, 2010). Auxiliary materials (cleaning and lubricating oil) is based on mean values from CH and WEU.

flow.name: operation, housing system, pig, fully-slatted floor, per pig place

exchanges.description: drinking water (820.2 kg) and service water (4020.9 kg) for pigs, piglets and sows. Note that, in Quebec farm, water is supposedly taken from ground well (Source: Quantis, Groupe AGECO, and CIRAIG, 2012. Environmental and Socioeconomic Life Cycle Assessment Of Canadian Milk, LCA study and report prepared for Dairy Farmers of Canada)

exchanges.description: Heat from propane (assuming 24.7 MJ/L propane) for building heating. Calculated value, from source data of 0.0613 and 0.02 L propane/kg carcass weight of finished pig from piglet farrowing and from pig finishing, respectively (OCO 2010).

exchanges.description: Calculated value, considering the following evaporation rates: 20% for service water, 30% for drinking water (evaporation through animal transpiration), 66% for water contained in excreted urine and faeces before liquid manure storage.
